repnme.cdata!: Thailand - Second Power System Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Power System Development Project
            in Thailand. The objectives of the project were to: (a) meet
            growth in power demand expected over the medium term at
            least cost; and (b) strengthen Electricity Generating
            Authority of Thailand's (EGAT) capabilities in
            environmental monitoring and evaluation through technical
            assistance and acquisition of monitoring equipment.
            Bank's performance was satisfactory. Borrower's
            performance was satisfactory. The key lessons learned were
            as follows: (a) certain shortcomings experienced during
            implementation suggest that management and staff skills need
            to be continuously updated to compensate for deficiencies in
            performance levels of contract workers; (b) the concept of
            time-slice lending has been successful and provides the
            Borrower with flexibility in arranging financing for its
            large investment program; (c) involvement of the private
            sector in mining operations has resulted in cost-effective
            and efficient operations; and (d) the close relationship
            between the Bank and EGAT has provided a channel for
            conducting wide-ranging discussions through which important
            initiatives have resulted in strengthening the utility.

repnme.cdata!: Thailand - Second Power System Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Power System Development
            Project will finance a two-year time slice of the
            Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand's (EGAT)
            investment program. It will help meet the growth in power
            demand expected over the medium-term; and strengthen the
            capabilities of EGAT in environmental monitoring and
            evaluation through technical assistance and acquisition of
            environmental monitoring equipment. The investment program
            of EGAT involves the expansion of generation facilities, the
            reinforcement and extension of transmission systems, the
            expansion of lignite mining capacity and other miscellaneous
            works. The program supports the development and economic use
            of domestic lignite and natural gas.
